Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Some problems with README Markdown rendering" (#8913) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

I've uploaded a README file together with my NuGet package (https://www.nuget.org/packages/PandocFilters/) and the rendered Markdown is a little less than ideal:
1. Language codes for code blocks are ignored; no syntax highlighting.
2. There is no whitespace between cells in the rendered table.
3. No support for superscript (`<sup>...</sup>`).

### Repro Steps

Upload a README file for a NuGet package containing misrendered Markdown.

### Expected Behavior

Syntax highlighting for code blocks should render properly.

There should be some whitespace between table cells.

A limited set of HTML elements should be supported, `sup` in my case.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "t[NuGet.org Bug]: Intel corp. cannot upload packages since Dec,9 to nuget.org with API" (#8908) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

We use a command:
for f in $(find <path> -name "*.nupkg" ); do echo $f; curl -H 'X-NuGet-ApiKey:<apikey>' -H 'X-NuGet-Protocol-Version: 4.1.0' -f -S --fail https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package -X PUT -F "data=@$f" --ciphers AES256-SHA


The response is:
[12:37] Perestoronin, Andrey
* Trying 52.240.159.111...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to www.nuget.org (52.240.159.111) port 443 (#0)
* ALPN, offering h2
* ALPN, offering http/1.1
* Cipher selection: AES256-SHA
* successfully set certificate verify locations:
* CAfile: /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt
CApath: /etc/ssl/certs
* TLSv1.3 (OUT), TLS handshake, Client hello (1):
* TLSv1.3 (IN), TLS handshake, Server hello (2):
* TLSv1.2 (IN), TLS handshake, Certificate (11):
* TLSv1.2 (IN), TLS handshake, Server finished (14):
* TLSv1.2 (OUT), TLS handshake, Client key exchange (16):
* TLSv1.2 (OUT), TLS change cipher, Client hello (1):
* TLSv1.2 (OUT), TLS handshake, Finished (20):
* TLSv1.2 (IN), TLS handshake, Finished (20):
* SSL connection using TLSv1.2 / AES256-SHA
* ALPN, server did not agree to a protocol
* Server certificate:
* subject: C=US; ST=WA; L=Redmond; O=Microsoft Corporation; CN=*.nuget.org
* start date: Oct 28 04:20:43 2021 GMT
* expire date: Oct 23 04:20:43 2022 GMT
* subjectAltName: host "www.nuget.org" matched cert's "*.nuget.org"
* issuer: C=US; O=Microsoft Corporation; CN=Microsoft Azure TLS Issuing CA 02
* SSL certificate verify ok.
> PUT /api/v2/package HTTP/1.1
> Host: www.nuget.org
> User-Agent: curl/7.58.0
> Accept: */*
> X-NuGet-ApiKey:
> X-NuGet-Protocol-Version: 4.1.0
> Content-Length: 16320443

< Set-Cookie: ARRAffinity=a772f7d26114a351ca4c91c481fd64df4c1b791d3577c9c23a1751ba712cdd47;Path=/;HttpOnly;Secure;Domain=nuget-prod-v2gallery-appservice.trafficmanager.net
< Set-Cookie: ARRAffinitySameSite=a772f7d26114a351ca4c91c481fd64df4c1b791d3577c9c23a1751ba712cdd47;Path=/;HttpOnly;SameSite=None;Secure;Domain=nuget-prod-v2gallery-appservice.trafficmanager.net
< Date: Mon, 13 Dec 2021 09:36:35 GMT
<
* Connection #0 to host www.nuget.org left intact

But we don't see the packages on nuget.org yet.
The list pf packages we tried to upload:

onevpl.devel.win-x64.2022.0.0.59.nupkg

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Spike] Spec AVERT client v2" (#8909) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: We're moving to a v2 client based on more complete specs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[online safety] Add communication workflow to support playbook for package safety report " (#8563) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Bug]: Packing a multi-target project fails to find the configured readme file" (#11467) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

6.0.101

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Create a blank C# project.
2. Create a readme.md file in the project.
3. Configure this readme file to be included in the package by right click project > Properties > Package > General > README, browse to said readme.md. Build and pack project once to verify that it packs successfully at this step.
4. Open the project's .csproj file, find `TargetFramework` tag and change it to `TargetFrameworks`. Note: adding additional target framework(s) in this tag is not necessary.
5. Build and pack project again to see the error.

### Verbose Logs

```shell
Error code: NU5039
The readme file 'readme.md' does not exist in the package.
A demonstrative video of reproducing this bug can also be found here: https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/598678594750775301/924001576643878923/2021-12-25_00-57-31.mp4
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PackageReference ungracefully handles duplicate Runtime Identifiers in csproj PackageReference " (#9290) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Specifically see: 

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/9ba90610a465d3c73921ba88b0e338b71a17fc72/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio/Projects/VsProjectAdapter.cs#L310-L313

Repro:
Create a csproj.dll PR project.
Manually edit the project and set:

```xml
<RuntimeIdentifier>win</RuntimeIdentifier>
<RuntimeIdentifiers>win</RuntimeIdentifiers>
```

And see an exception:
```cs
 System.ArgumentException: An item with the same key has already been added.
```

Validate the same experience with SDK based projects.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Introduce a warning for null/empty version range (new or reuse NU1604)" (#9767) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NU1604 currently complains that a project has a dependency without an inclusive lower bound.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/errors-and-warnings/nu1604

Now, often times this is true, but most frequently, the problem is that someone was playing with MSBuild and the variable that contains the version is now empty.  

The message can reflect that. 

We could introduce a new warning, but maybe there's no need for that.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: Package Source Mapping matches found should not be logged for projects" (#11413) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, MSBuild.exe, NuGet.exe

### Product Version

6.0

### Worked before?

No

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

Say you have a NuGet.Config setup as following, with source mapping enabled: 

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <config>
    <add key="globalPackagesFolder" value="packages" />
  </config>
  <packageSources>
    <!--To inherit the global NuGet package sources remove the <clear/> line below -->
    <clear />
    <add key="nuget" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" />
    <add key="dotnet-core" value="https://dotnetfeed.blob.core.windows.net/dotnet-core/index.json" />
  </packageSources>
  <packageSourceMapping>
    <packageSource key="nuget">
      <package pattern="*" />
    </packageSource>
    <packageSource key="dotnet-core">
      <package pattern="Contoso.*" />
    </packageSource>
  </packageSourceMapping>
</configuration>

```


and you have a project called `Contoso.Application`, referencing `Contoso.Lib1` (project as well). 

The logs would display.

```console
Package source mapping matches found for package ID 'Contoso.Application' are: 'nuget,dotnet-core'.
         Package source mapping matches found for package ID 'Contoso.Lib1' are: 'nuget,dotnet-core'.
         Package source mapping matches found for package ID 'Contoso.Lib1' are: 'nuget,dotnet-core'.
         Package source mapping matches found for package ID 'Newtonsoft.Json' are: 'nuget'.
         Package source mapping matches found for package ID 'Newtonsoft.Json' are: 'nuget'.
```

which is misleading. 



[PackageSourceMappingPlayground.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/7598161/PackageSourceMappingPlayground.zip)

Originally reported in https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/11406 by @cheesi. 

### Verbose Logs

```shell
Using "RestoreTask" task from assembly "C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\6.0.100\NuGet.Build.Tasks.dll".
       Task "RestoreTask"
         (in) RestoreGraphItems Count '10'
         (in) RestoreDisableParallel 'False'
         (in) RestoreNoCache 'False'
         (in) RestoreIgnoreFailedSources 'False'
         (in) RestoreRecursive 'True'
         (in) RestoreForce 'False'
         (in) HideWarningsAndErrors 'False'
         (in) RestoreForceEvaluate 'False'
         (in) RestorePackagesConfig 'False'
         Running restore with 8 concurrent jobs.
         Reading project file C:\Code\Temp\PackageSourceMappingPlayground\Contoso.Application\Contoso.Application.csproj.
         Reading project file C:\Code\Temp\PackageSourceMappingPlayground\Contoso.Lib1\Contoso.Lib1.csproj.
         The restore inputs for 'Contoso.Application' have changed. Continuing restore.
         The restore inputs for 'Contoso.Lib1' have changed. Continuing restore.
         Restoring packages for C:\Code\Temp\PackageSourceMappingPlayground\Contoso.Lib1\Contoso.Lib1.csproj...
         Restoring packages for C:\Code\Temp\PackageSourceMappingPlayground\Contoso.Application\Contoso.Application.csproj...
         Restoring packages for .NETCoreApp,Version=v6.0...
         Restoring packages for .NETCoreApp,Version=v6.0...
         Package source mapping matches found for package ID 'Contoso.Application' are: 'nuget,dotnet-core'.
         Package source mapping matches found for package ID 'Contoso.Lib1' are: 'nuget,dotnet-core'.
         Package source mapping matches found for package ID 'Contoso.Lib1' are: 'nuget,dotnet-core'.
         Package source mapping matches found for package ID 'Newtonsoft.Json' are: 'nuget'.
         Package source mapping matches found for package ID 'Newtonsoft.Json' are: 'nuget'.
           GET https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/newtonsoft.json/index.json
           OK https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/newtonsoft.json/index.json 174ms
           GET https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/newtonsoft.json/13.0.1/newtonsoft.json.13.0.1.nupkg
           OK https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/newtonsoft.json/13.0.1/newtonsoft.json.13.0.1.nupkg 10ms
         Resolving conflicts for net6.0...
         Resolving conflicts for net6.0...
         Acquiring lock for the installation of Newtonsoft.Json 13.0.1
         Acquiring lock for the installation of Newtonsoft.Json 13.0.1
         Acquired lock for the installation of Newtonsoft.Json 13.0.1
         PackageSignatureVerificationLog: PackageIdentity: Newtonsoft.Json.13.0.1 Source: https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json PackageSignatureValidity: True
         Installed Newtonsoft.Json 13.0.1 from https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json with content hash ppPFpBcvxdsfUonNcvITKqLl3bqxWbDCZIzDWHzjpdAHRFfZe0Dw9HmA0+za13IdyrgJwpkDTDA9fHaxOrt20A==.
         Lock not required - Package already installed Newtonsoft.Json 13.0.1

         All packages and projects are compatible with net6.0.

         Committing restore...

         Generating MSBuild file C:\Code\Temp\PackageSourceMappingPlayground\Contoso.Lib1\obj\Contoso.Lib1.csproj.nuget.g.props.

         Writing assets file to disk. Path: C:\Code\Temp\PackageSourceMappingPlayground\Contoso.Application\obj\project.assets.json
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]: dotnet list package --include-transitive --vulnerable shoud return nopn-zero status code when issues are found" (#11463) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:

The the CI could break build when problems are found.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: nuget 6 not including native file " (#11431) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

6.0.0.280

### Worked before?

5.11.0.10

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

I am trying to wrap into a nuget package some native c++ code, using the following nuspec file

```
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<package >
    <metadata>
        <id>PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default</id>
        <version>0.0.0</version>
        <description>NA</description>
		<authors> Vincenzo Ferrazzano</authors>
        <tags>native Native nativepackage C++ binaries vc142</tags>
        <dependencies>
            <dependency id="Google.Protobuf_v142" version="3.17.3" />
        </dependencies>
    </metadata>
    <files>
		<file src="./pb_api/mpg2axioma_api/mpg2axioma_cpp/x64/Debug/*.pdb"                  target="build/native/lib/x64/v142/Debug/"     />
        <file src="./pb_api/mpg2axioma_api/mpg2axioma_cpp/x64/Debug/*.lib"     	            target="build/native/lib/x64/v142/Debug/"  />
		<file src="./pb_api/mpg2axioma_api/mpg2axioma_cpp/x64/Release/*.pdb"       		    target="build/native/lib/x64/v142/Release/"     />
        <file src="./pb_api/mpg2axioma_api/mpg2axioma_cpp/x64/Release/*.lib"     	        target="build/native/lib/x64/v142/Release/"  />
        <file src="./pb_api/mpg2axioma_api/mpg2axioma_cpp/src/*.h"  	                    target="build/native/include" />
        <file src="PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default.props"   					target="build" />
        <file src="./pb_api/mpg2axioma_api/mpg2axioma.proto"   					          target="build" />
    </files>
</package>
```

All the files are existing and correcly located. 
I have noticed that the new version of nuget does not include the native files, while the version 5 did.
See attached logs

### Verbose Logs

```shell
*****Previous version******

PS C:\sw_source\PVIM_protobuffer> ./nuget5.exe pack  PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default.nuspec -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 5.11.0.10
Attempting to build package from 'PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default.nuspec'.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: After adding key via `nuget setApiKey`, push commands error with `Key not valid for use in specified state.` & exit with code 1" (#11428) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

5.11.0.10

### Worked before?

Worked before a machine reload, so I have to assume the problem is more with setApiKey than with push perhaps?

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

1. generate an api key at nuget.org
2. `nuget setApiKey {key} -source nuget.org`
3. `nuget.exe push {package} -NonInteractive -Source nuget.org -Timeout 300 -SkipDuplicate`
4. process exits with code 1 and an error about the key state

### Verbose Logs

```shell
➜ nuget.exe push .\.release-packages\PeanutButter.XmlUtils.2.0.50.nupkg -NonInteractive -SOurce nuget.org -Timeout 300 -SkipDuplicate -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 5.4.0.6315
Pushing PeanutButter.XmlUtils.2.0.50.nupkg to 'https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package'...
  PUT https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/
  Conflict https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/ 7430ms
Package 'C:\code\opensource\PeanutButter\.\.release-packages\PeanutButter.XmlUtils.2.0.50.nupkg' already exists at feed 'https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package'.
Key not valid for use in specified state.
System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException: Key not valid for use in specified state.

   at System.Security.Cryptography.ProtectedData.Unprotect(Byte[] encryptedData, Byte[] optionalEntropy, DataProtectionScope scope)
   at NuGet.Configuration.EncryptionUtility.DecryptString(String encryptedString)
   at NuGet.Configuration.SettingsUtility.GetDecryptedValueForAddItem(ISettings settings, String section, String key, Boolean isPath)
   at NuGet.Commands.CommandRunnerUtility.GetApiKey(ISettings settings, String endpoint, String source, String defaultApiKey, Boolean isSymbolApiKey)
   at NuGet.Commands.PushRunner.<>c__DisplayClass0_0.<Run>b__1(String symbolsEndpoint)
   at NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.PackageUpdateResource.<Push>d__14.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at NuGet.Commands.PushRunner.<Run>d__0.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.PushCommand.<ExecuteCommandAsync>d__36.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.Execute()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Program.MainCore(String workingDirectory, String[] args)
```
